content.description:
This is the crack that you take all of your friends to for their first time climbing! Fun pitch all around.

For a neat variation the line between center crack and Right crack is around a 5.8/5.9.

On the main crack wall this is essentially the left side crack just to the left of 'Right Crack'. Super fun, well sustained and crux is towards the top. Perfect for a beginner on TR or great to practice placing trad gear
content.protection: .5"-4" gear of any kind. Great crack lots of options

content.description:
Super fun route that you can find by the solid bolts going up. Around to the left is the walk off where you can set up a top rope if you want (easy walk)

There are no rings at the top, however there are 2 hangars you can set up an anchor from.
content.location: Approx 100' East of the Cracked Wall. This rock is slightly darker and easily noticeable

content.description:
You can't miss the arête on the right hand side of cracked wall. You have to set up a TR because there is no real good placements for trad gear. You may want to set up a 'self equalizing anchor' if you are going to stick to the arête because you start the route on the right and side and can finish on the left.

Staying to the right on the slab I heard is a 5.11 but I have never done it myself. If you have any beta on it just let me know though!
content.protection:
2 hangars at the top, no rappel rings

This has 2 stars because trad protection is very limited, I would not recommend leading
content.location: Walk off on the right hand side
